channel.title: Dartmouth Interview
channel.description: So I just got called about an alumni interview for Dartmouth. I applied Early Decision. What should I ask? What should I tell them? Any tips or things to keep in mind or never do? It's going to be at a restaraunt/cafe, and there will be two alumni interrogating/interviewing me. Slightly scared.

item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:

Bien.

Dunno I assume she likes it, but I haven’t seen her in ages. She getting some lame history or lit degree though

item.title: Dartmouth Interview
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Bobby, post:11, topic:161003”]Proabably a little value is placed on it. how old are the interviewers ( like 24 or like 64?)

just a random tidbit I feel like posting: my cousin goes there[/quote]

I actually have no idea how old they are. They sound like they’re in their 30’s/40’s/50’s. And how does your cousin feel about it? Bien/mal?

Do they report back to the college? ( I would think so.)

[quote=“fellixombc, post:8, topic:161003”]EDIT: Its a collage right?

item.title: Dartmouth Interview
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Just think of a few things you really want to tell them, like why you really want to go to their college. Dress up like you will when you have the interview. Then stand in front of a mirror, or your parents (this is better) and just pretend they are the interviewers. Then let them judge you. I don’t know if there are special requirements, but if there are make a list of them, and try to see them as questions. Then try to think a few answers for them.

Anyways, good luck and I hope you get accepted. (I hope an alumni interview is what I think it is (interview to get accepted in a college), else just ignore the stuff I wrote)

Read full topic

item.title: Dartmouth Interview
item.dc:creator: @daycrawler daycrawler
item.description:
@daycrawler wrote:

Just be firm in your answers and ask like where do you think dartmouth can take me? Wear a suit, give a firm handshake, look them in the eye when talking to them.

Read full topic

item.title: Dartmouth Interview
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

well you can use my favorite question for any and all interviews and anything of that sort

Is there one question you want me to ask? and if so what is the answer.

produces good results for me…
(note: I am sure I am certaintly not the first to use this question)

Read full topic
